headline.main: ACID RAIN SEEN AS POSING RISKS FOR U.S. HEALTH

byline.original: By PHILIP SHABECOFF, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Acid rain and the pollutants that cause it are a serious threat to human health, especially to children, representatives of major public health groups told a Congressional panel today.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Acid rain and the pollutants that cause it are a serious threat to human health, especially to children, representatives of major public health groups told a Congressional panel today.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In ''Is Resource Recovery the Way to Go?'' (Jan. 11), Steven Pollock of the Ocean County Planning Board argued that solid-waste incinerators were a relatively safe technology. He asserted that the small amount of contamination that issues from them is insignificant when compared to the dangers of landfilling wastes.
